bioghist.p: Elizabeth Ripley (1906-1969) was an author of children's books. Most of her books were biographies of artists written for an audience of young adults. Her subjects included Rodin, Van Gogh, Copley, Rembrandt, Michaelangelo, Homer, Picasso, and the Japanese artist Hokusai.

scopecontent.p: This is a collection of manuscripts and notes of Elizabeth Ripley. The materials relate to three of the author's books: Copley, Hokusai, and Rodin: A Biography. Materials include typescripts, outlines and notes, dummies and blueprint dummies, page proofs and galley proofs, photographs, and correspondence.
